replication_study.hypothesis: In a panel of U.S. states (2007–2013), logged average weekly working hours per worker will be positively associated with logged state-level CO2 emissions from fossil fuel combustion, controlling for economic and demographic drivers (scale and composition specifications).

data_plan.dataset_identifier: compiled.dta (state panel), with epa.dta and hhsize.dta available; version as provided in replication_data
data_plan.sample_size: 350 observations (50 states × 7 years), per post_registration.json; actual rows after log-eligibility filtering are reported by the script.
data_plan.access_details: Data provided locally in ./data/original/7/data-only/replication_data. Analysis assumes mounted at /app/data/original/7/data-only/replication_data inside container.

qualification.explanation: The compiled.dta dataset contains the key variables for the focal models: emissions (carbon_adj), working hours (wrkhrs), and core economic/demographic controls (labor productivity, employment-population ratio, population, energy production, manufacturing). It enables a close replication of the original FE panel regressions with logged variables across 2007–2013.
qualification.similarity_to_original: The original paper uses a balanced panel of all 50 states from 2007–2013 with logged variables and two-way FE/Prais–Winsten PCSEs (post_registration.json: data.wave_or_subset, method.models, method.outcome_variable, method.independent_variables, method.control_variables). The compiled.dta shows 500 rows total (50×10 years), integer year coded 7–16 (2007–2016) and includes columns: carbon_adj, wrkhrs, laborprod, emppop, pop, energy, manuf (tool outputs for compiled.dta info/head/columns). We subset to 2007–2013 to match the original period (post_registration.json) and log-transform continuous variables as in the paper (original_paper.pdf summary: variables logged; methods).
qualification.deviation_from_original: The original study includes additional controls (state environmentalism via LCV scores and household size) and uses Prais–Winsten PCSEs with AR(1) within panels (post_registration.json: method.models, method.control_variables). The provided compiled.dta does not include LCV or household size, and given the emulation stability constraints, we implemented a pure-NumPy OLS with fixed effects and cluster-robust SEs by state. This yields elasticities comparable in interpretation but may deviate in standard errors relative to PCSE/AR(1).

data_plan.notes: Year is coded as integers 7–16 corresponding to 2007–2016 in compiled.dta. All continuous variables used in models are log-transformed; rows with non-positive values on any logged variable are dropped. Outputs saved to /app/data.

planned_method.steps: 1) Load compiled.dta. 2) Construct year_actual=2000+year and subset to 2007–2013. 3) Log-transform continuous variables (carbon_adj, wrkhrs, laborprod, emppop, pop, energy, manuf, rgdp/gdp). 4) Build design matrix with state and year fixed effects using dummies. 5) Estimate two specifications via OLS with cluster-robust SEs by state. 6) Compute correlation of first differences between ln_wrkhrs and ln_carbon_adj. 7) Save outputs to /app/data.
planned_method.models: Two-way fixed-effects OLS with cluster-robust (state) SEs implemented in NumPy.
planned_method.outcome_variable: ln_carbon_adj (log of adjusted state CO2 emissions)
planned_method.independent_variables: Primary: ln_wrkhrs (log of average weekly working hours). Composition specification additionally includes ln_rgdp (or ln_gdp).
planned_method.control_variables: Scale model: ln_laborprod, ln_emppop, ln_pop, ln_energy, ln_manuf, plus state and year fixed effects. Composition model: ln_rgdp (or ln_gdp), ln_pop, ln_energy, ln_manuf, plus state and year fixed effects.
planned_method.tools_software: Python 3.10; pandas for data handling; numpy for numeric ops; pure-NumPy OLS for stability under emulation.

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Elasticity (coefficient) of ln_wrkhrs on ln_carbon_adj in FE panel models (scale and composition).
planned_estimation_and_test.test: Two-sided z-tests on coefficients using cluster-robust standard errors by state.

planned_method.missing_data_handling: Listwise deletion after filtering out non-positive values for any variable to be logged.
planned_method.multiple_testing_policy: Not applicable (single focal outcome; two related model specifications).
planned_method.inference_criteria: Primary criterion: positive and statistically significant coefficient on ln_wrkhrs at alpha=0.05 in scale and composition FE models; magnitude compared to original elasticities (~0.668 scale; ~0.675/0.552 composition).

files.run_replication.py: Entry-point script. Loads /app/data/original/7/data-only/replication_data/compiled.dta; constructs log variables; subsets to 2007–2013; runs two two-way FE models with cluster-robust SEs by state; computes first-difference correlation; writes outputs to /app/data (replication_results_summary.txt, replication_coefficients.csv, replication_sample_info.json).

codebase.notes: All IO is under /app/data. Requires pandas, numpy, and pyreadstat (for Stata IO backend used by pandas).

analysis.instructions: 1) Ensure data is available at ./data and mounted to /app/data. 2) Install required packages. 3) Run: python /app/data/original/7/data-only/replication_data/run_replication.py. 4) Inspect outputs: /app/data/replication_results_summary.txt, /app/data/replication_coefficients.csv, /app/data/replication_sample_info.json.
analysis.comparison_metrics: Compare ln_wrkhrs elasticities to original (~0.668 scale; ~0.675/0.552 composition) and assess significance (p<0.05).
